abstract: Nicholas Kristof Op-Ed column celebrates prospect that South Carolina may remove Confederate flag from its statehouse, calling it clear symbol of slavery and racial violence; holds movement to remove flags may have symbolic power, but depths of racial inequality in America go far deeper; argues time has come to address true forces thwarting lives of black Americans--poverty, education, shorter life expectancy and mass incarceration.
lead_paragraph: I’m all for celebrating the drawing down of the flag, but now let’s pivot from symbolic moves to substantial ones.

headline.main: Tearing Down the Confederate Flag Is Just a Start
headline.print_headline: Tearing Down the Confederate Flag Is Just a Start

snippet: I’m all for celebrating the drawing down of the flag, but now let’s pivot from symbolic moves to substantial ones.
